intro: Ulex scaber var. willkommii, commonly known as the rough hedgehog. It is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia, characterized by its spiny, thorned stems and small, yellow flowers. The plant is a member of the Fabaceae family, also known as the legume or bean family. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three oval-shaped leaflets, and it produces pods that contain several seeds. This variety is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in sunny, open habitats.
